a:r.a:t: Educate consumers about the importance of incorporating sleep into their health regimens, especially during COVID-19.

Achieving health goals does not only entail regular exercise and a balanced diet; it also requires quality sleep. Good sleep can boost the immune system and thus the body’s resistance to disease – essential in a pandemic world.​
Encourage consumers to exercise to improve sleep.

Highlight the mutually beneficial relationship between exercise and sleep, with the former contributing to the latter. Also consider promoting working out to reduce jetlag. This could help fitness brands to target tourists in new destinations. ​

As consumers look for alternatives to traditional prescription medication, many will be keen to try natural supplements or alternative remedies to support sleep. However, ensure that their benefits are thoroughly researched and tested before bringing them to market or making sleep-related claims. ​
Help consumers build sleep routines and rituals.

Routines – for example, going to bed and waking up at the same time each day – are proven to boost sleep hygiene. Help consumers create a sleep ritual that works for them – whether it be a relaxing bath, a steaming cup of tea or a meditative journaling session. ​
Develop, or partner with, nap bars.

Some consumers may need a third place to squeeze in additional sleep. Nap bars and dedicated sleep pods in gyms and spas are cropping up to accommodate this need, particularly in urban areas. Naps are thought to improve both productivity and overall health, so such spaces can be promoted as a wellbeing tool. These are typically equipped with sleep aids – from weighted blankets to noise-cancelling headphones – making them opportune spaces to partner with if you have relevant products to offer. ​
Explore the link between dreams and wellbeing.

Research demonstrates that dreams are often revelatory of internal states, providing insights for self-assessment. Also, a longer duration of rapid eye movement (REM) sleep is linked to more vibrant dreams, which in turn may enhance creativity. Finally, dreams are a safe space in which we can process, albeit subconsciously, the myriad stimuli we encounter during our waking moments. Consider exploring the various links between dreams and wellbeing, and how your brand can support positive dream states.
